samples.context: If a student meets with Dr. Dancik during office hours, then they can get help on their project. Once the project help is received, the student will complete the assignment on time.

qa_pairs.question: If Lily meets with Dr. Dancik, does this mean that she will finish the assignment on time?
If Lily doesn't meet with Dr. Dancik, does this imply that she won't finish on time?
If Lily meets with Dr. Dancik, does this entail that she won't finish on time?
If Lily doesn't meet with Dr. Dancik, does this imply that she will finish on time?

samples.context: If a student attends CSC 101, then they will understand programming basics. Understanding programming basics will result in them passing the midterm exam.

qa_pairs.question: If Adam attends CSC 101, does this mean that he will pass the midterm?
If Adam doesn't attend CSC 101, does this entail that he won't pass the midterm?
If Adam attends CSC 101, does this imply that he won't pass the midterm?
If Adam doesn't attend CSC 101, does this imply that he will pass the midterm?

samples.context: If a student goes to Dr. Gao's office hours, then they can review the algorithms homework. Reviewing the homework will help them perform better on the next quiz.

qa_pairs.question: If Kathy goes to Dr. Gao's office hours, does this mean that she will do well on the quiz?
If Kathy doesn't go to Dr. Gao's office hours, does this entail that she won't do well on the quiz?
If Kathy goes to Dr. Gao's office hours, does this mean that she won't do well on the quiz?
If Kathy doesn't go to Dr. Gao's office hours, does this entail that she will do well on the quiz?

samples.context: If a student regularly attends the ECSU Math Lab, then they will improve their calculus skills. When calculus skills improve, the student will perform better in class.

qa_pairs.question: If John goes to the Math Lab, does this imply that he will do better in class?
If John doesn't go to the Math Lab, does this imply that he won't do better in class?
If John goes to the Math Lab, does this entail that he won't do better in class?
If John doesn't go to the Math Lab, does this entail that he will do better in class?

samples.context: If a student attends the ECSU Honors meeting, then they will hear about upcoming research opportunities. Learning about opportunities will result in being able to apply for them.

qa_pairs.question: If Jill attends the Honors meeting, does this entail that she can apply for opportunities?
If Jill doesn't attend the Honors meeting, does this entail that she won't be able to apply?
If Jill attends the Honors meeting, does this imply that she won't be able to apply?
If Jill doesn't attend the Honors meeting, does this imply that she will be able to apply?
